html:
6.15.17  5:41 am   how long do you think a tiger will take to eat the whole universe

     forever

6.15.17  5:18 am   Do you consider yourself a shitposter?

     no

      why do you do such short, seemingly meaningless videos?

6.15.17  5:01 am   Can we be best friends

     sure

6.15.17  3:31 am   you're not some self-help guru trying to give hope to the hopeless are you?

     not necessarily, but they will ask me anyway

6.15.17  3:07 am   why do you do anagrams?

     why do you do anagrams == "yay, good words" - a human

6.15.17  2:14 am   Do you answer dm's on Instagram? And fan mail?

     i don't think i can get dms on instagram. i do all 1 on 1 correspondence through email

6.15.17  1:53 am   I think Pandora is a really popular platform for musical artists as well. But I don't know what kind of requirements they put artists through.

     one of the companies i pay to upload my music says they send it to pandora. but pandora is not putting it online. you could try to ask them why but i don't think you'll get a response. pandora is a high priority because it is very popular but i don't know how to get my music there. i am paying a company who says they are doing it but pandora does not seem to be accepting it

6.15.17  1:49 am   Since when did hats stop being bad

     i have not been keeping track of whether hats are bad. surely each person can evaluate hats on a hat to hat basis

6.15.17  1:20 am   have you considered combining some of the song ideas on your list to get through it more effectively? i mean, if they were deemed worthy to write down for posterity, they're certainly already good ideas and concepts, and putting these ideas together might also streamline the writing process a bit

     in my experience, combining songs is not a good strategy. each song has its own very unique needs and it is important to consider exactly what that song needs in order to make it the strongest song. combining 2 halfwritten songs would be kind of like combining 2 half built houses and hoping it makes sense. although i suppose it may work for some people, and i think that's great. the last time i revealed here that i don't combine songs someone got mad at me. so it is important to emphasize the fact that other people may have success in doing that but it is not something that i think makes sense for me

6.15.17  12:35 am   Do you ever get complaints from your neighbors for playing your drum set too loud?

     i don't play it here

6.15.17  12:16 am   when did you first recognize the you had a discernible style that differed from most other content creators on YouTube?

     i never expected it to be the same

6.14.17  10:18 pm   Am I the only person who likes you for your songs?

     no

     Don't get me wrong-I love your history videos, but the short, quick style of your songs is great. I feel like people don't appreciate your songs as much as they like your history videos-just a thought. -Bogg

6.14.17  10:15 pm   H e l p . I a m I n t I m e a n d s p a c e . W h a t d o I d o?

     have fun!

6.14.17  9:18 pm   Why are hats bad?

     they are not

6.14.17  8:57 pm   Why was 2012 the most stressful year for you when it came to writing music?

     it was not

6.14.17  8:31 pm   how far along was next tuesday's song when you selected it? also this is just a side comment but i'm just blown away by the "and i know you're probably wondering who you are" line in "movie star", i'm astonished you came up with that, let alone an amazing full song, in a week

     this week's song was in exactly the same shape as movie star, it was just one chorus line. finished the writing on tuesday, length is about 2:35. i honestly don't know how it will be possible to finish this one on time this week. movie star was major crunch time and i think this one is slightly behind schedule from where i was last week. i blame the fact that i divided my time on monday between other projects such as reality updates, notes updates, getting my image to spotify, various other things, including [WRITING A NEW VIDEO]. and the punishment is that i might have screwed the chances of finishing the song on time. i suppose that's what i get for trying to do things other than songs

6.14.17  7:21 pm   Here is a previously answered question: 6.13.17 10:52 pm What inspired you to start uploading your stuff to the internet? because i wanted people to have a way to see it any time they want without me having to send it to them indivutually Why did you make a typo in the word "Individually"?

     because i accidentally pressed the wrong buttons on the typing keyboard i hope that makes sense

      Was it a creative decision, or possibly an attack on someone who has hurt you before?

     no

6.14.17  7:02 pm   Do you use your randomization system for just choosing which project to work on?

     i was doing that in early 2015

     Or is it also used for determining different aspects of the music itself? I thought it was for just picking songs but Ive seen a couple question asking why you've chosen to include a horn part for certain songs and you said it was a result of the randomization system.

     i am currently using randomization for song selection, and i also have a randomization system for recording

6.14.17  5:53 pm   I am listening music all time when am creating creative stuff.What should i do when i am creating music?

     probably not listen to other music, besides the music you are making. maybe it's good to take a break and listen to other music, and then come back to yours for a fresh perspective. but listening to other music while making your music would be kind of like doing a wine taste test with oranges already in your mouth

6.14.17  5:18 pm   Did gaining popularity (over the years) lessen your feeling of loneliness?

     it made it better and worse in different ways

6.14.17  5:17 pm   Do you watch Seinfeld?

     only behind the scenes

6.14.17  5:07 pm   You've said you use a voice recorder to replace writing with sheet music but i don't understand how you actually get all of the information on that page into a recording? do you go through the melody and then go through again and say all the chords? Also if possible could you upload an example of one of these (a song thats finished of course)

     oh sure

6.14.17  4:37 pm   why do the songs have to be done by saturday?

     so they can get to most of the major sites by tuesday

6.14.17  4:37 pm   how many things are there?

     at least 2

6.14.17  3:43 pm   do you ever try recording songs without writing them? just writing them in your head piece by piece and recording every idea you get in real time? or is it does it end up too unstructered and weird? is that a problem though?

     i have learned from experience that that is not the way for me to get the best results. ultimately i perform the strongest when i write the song first and finalize the entire road map before starting the session. that's just the best way to play to my strengths. everyone is different, and i have tried both ways and i've found that it is much better for me to write first

6.14.17  3:38 pm   i understand that you don't want searching for better and better sounds all the time to get in your way of just writing and recording, but don't you want to transcend a lot of cultural elements that have no distinct purpose to you that you were born into? like approximating the way notes fit together in harmony by using the equal temperament tuning? i dont mean like retune your keyboards, but when talking about microtonal music, i usually tend to think of tuning chords to the harmonic series, rather than the piano. i just hope you actively do that when you can instead of using an easier way all the time to get more content finished. after all you do seem like quite the creativity purist. hell im sure you've thought about it tho. nevermind. you don't need to respond to this im just rambling cause i get triggered when you say no to microtonal music. ur right, splitting half notes in half again doesn't really make that much sense

     ah, you are suggesting that i pursue the 'perfect' tuning, instead of using equal temperment tuning. this sounds like a righteous idea, but i have to tell you that i embarked on a viscious mission (in about january 2011 i believe) to get to the bottom of this situation. i set out to get a perfect tuning that at least worked in 1 key. after many hours (days? i don't remember) of experimentation, what i found surprised me. you actually can't do it. even to play within 1 key, you need to compromise. let me see if i can explain it: start by tuning a C chord properly (so that the E is a true harmony with C, and the G is a true 5th from C.) So let's get our F, that's gonna be a true 5th down from C, right? now A should be a pure major third above F, for sure. and B should surely be a pure major 3rd above G. now what should D be? you would assume that it would be a pure ninth from C (i.e. the frequency times 9 and then divided back down the octaves) which is good for the G chord also because it will be a 5th away from G. looks great, so now you've got C, D, E, F, G, A, B. but what you find next might come as a shock. D minor sounds like a nightmare. because D to A is supposed to be a 5th and now it is a very very wrong 5th. because you tuned your A to be a harmonically pure major 3rd away from F. no matter how you slice it, you inevitably run into the same argument where a 3rd needs to be a purely harmonic 3rd, but also needs to be a series of 5ths. i juggled the possibilities all around for at least a day, and i was completely stunned to find out that the essence of music, and specifically the way the "secondary" notes (let's say in a major key, the secondary notes are D, F, A, and also G, and the primary notes are C,E,G. that's right, G is both, the universe is a love paradox, get used to it) the secondary notes need equal tempered tuning to work right. there are surely many different ways to look at this and i made up the primary and secondary classifications for this example, but the point is that there will always be overlap. you will never have 2 exclusive sets of notes. it stems from the fact that the D note needs to be able to relate to G, but also needs to relate to the A, but the A also needs to relate to the F, and the F also definitely needs to relate to the C. now you might say "ok, tune them differently depending on what chords you're using." but that really doesn't work right, because music needs all these notes to coexist. you're not going to just expect that Dmin and Fmaj will never need to blend together with the A held over. or that Dmin and Gmaj will never need to blend together with the D held over. At the end of this mind exploding journey, i basically found that it seems to be summed up perfectly in 2 chords. Cmaj, and like any combination of D,F,A, and G perhaps with G in the bass. in that 'secondary' chord, all in one moment, (which is the 'less' stable of the 2 chords when they are used in a musical context) that chord encapsulates the dual nature of the way these harmonies are working. is the F in that chord supposed to relate mainly to the C? or is it supposed to relate to the D in a pure minor third? and similarly, is the D supposed to relate to the G? the answer is, all 3 of these relationships are supposed to hold together. but this is mathematically impossible to happen exactly. so the entire essence of that Dmin, or 5dom7(sus if you like?) whatever, 'secondary' chord, the entire essence of that chord is that it contains different relationships that have to all sound like they work and yet they could never all 3 work exactly. the chord needs compromise in order to work. perhaps that is why it feels like the secondary chord or the 'less stable' or the 'i'm just waiting to go back to C' chord. realizing this changed me, because i was always told that equal tempered tuning was mainly used as a compromise to play in all 12 keys. but what i realized is you actually need it just to play in 1 key. like, just to play a 1 and a 2min. just to play the most basic essence of a key and have it work with itself. it really made me appreciate that 'secondary' chord (Dmin, G, etc) the D to F and the D to G relationship on kind of an earth shattering spiritual level, it's like the damn thing has heartbreak built right in. what you think you are hearing is the d to f relationship and the d to g relationship and the f to c relationthip, etc, all at the same time, when really it could never be, at least not exactly. but it is close enough to feel it. basically ever since this experiment i have had a wildly new appreciation for how and why music works, on an even more 'human' level than i expected. and i never questioned equal tempered tuning again

6.14.17  3:36 pm   Do you usually write songs starting with the melody or starting with the harmony?

     no

      In other words, do you come up with a melody and then come up with chord changes that compliment it?

     no

     Or the other way around?

     no, i do it both at the same time

6.14.17  3:30 pm   I think it's a good thing to learn as much music theory as possible, because learning theory will give you different "tools" that you can chose to use (or not use) at your disposal. But one thing I've noticed with these theory-nerds (myself included) is that they'll over think things. Sometimes a simple ii-V-I sounds better than a tritone substitution. Sometimes a triad (or a two part harmony, or even a single note) works better than a fancy extended chord. I think I'm a much better player after years of studying and learning, but when I was first learning music I'd write songs much faster and more easily than I do now... Do you ever run into this probelm?

     not since i was much younger

     Do you ever catch yourself over thinking things or trying to make songs more complex than they need to be?

     i think when you first start to learn how things work, it is normal to try to use the things you are learning in ways that emphasize the those particular things. but i think over time you will gravitate back toward the big picture. also it's important to remember that music can be described in as many different ways as you want, but the only fully accurate way to describe it is the way it sounds

6.14.17  3:18 pm   The human brain is made up of molecules, which are made up of elements. Scientists know how different molecules/elements interact with eachother, how they will form bonds, react, release energy,etc. So if molecules behave in ways that are 100% predictible, do we really have free will?

     there are some things that are divided into exactly 50/50 chance. consciousness exploits this 50% area

6.14.17  1:51 pm   I've seen you bring up the importance of having "creative freedom" several times here on this site. Do you ever feel like your creative freedom is restricted in any way right now (or has been in the past)? Or is it more that you're afraid it'd be restricted if you were to get more involved in the business side of music (signing to a label, working on projects for other people/companies, etc)?

     if you are not working for anyone else, then you usually do have creative freedom. but it is easy to forget

6.14.17  12:09 pm   If it is raining at 12:00 A.M, could you expect sunny weather in 72 hours?

     probably not at your location, unless the sun is normally up at 12am in your location at the current time of year. but i think at most of those locations it would probably snow instead

6.14.17  10:50 am   what do u think of virtual reality?

     i am looking forward to the chance to explore it more and look into possibilities of making things there

6.14.17  10:41 am   For what you have said before, you use randomness often in the process of creating your content. Which benefices you think it provides?

     if it's really true that you can make something out of anything, it can be extremely useful to use randomization in various ways, as a starting point. especially when it feels like you have already tried all the starting points that you would normally think of. i think many artists do this in various ways

6.14.17  10:37 am   How many albums do you think all your songs could fit in

     it depends how big you think an album should be

6.14.17  10:31 am   why do you use inverted/slash chords in "gonna chase myself through hell" and other works? how do you see them as useful? (not that i don't, just wondering)

     i just use the notes and chords i think best support the song or video at that moment. whether or not you choose to represent them with slashes is your choice

6.14.17  10:20 am   how do you stay motivated for huge projects w/o burning out

     it helps if you are confident that it's the right project, and also if you are confident in the process. a good way to work yourself up to that is to do a series of much shorter projects, which get done much more easily, and each one is a chance to learn new tricks and refine the process

6.14.17  9:45 am   Jeez Bill you used "The Lick" in your most recent song at t=2:00. Is partially why you mention "sell[ing] out" in the next line?

     no, the lick was added on the recording like most of the auxiliary instrumental 'responses', it was not written into the song. but i don't understand why the Lick would relate to selling out, it's not like anybody is getting paid to do the Lick

6.14.17  6:48 am   You said the chorus to movie star was written in dec 2015. I was under the impression that back then you were working on history of japan. I was also under the impression that you always do a project as quickly as possible to move on to the next thing. What do you have to say in your defense? (jk bill i love u keep doing your thing)

     sometimes it is important to do 2 projects at the same time. the 'movie star' hook was written on a vine writing session, which also yielded 'hate myself', 'clean my room', 'made some bread in my head', and several others. sometimes the hooks i come up with seem like they might be better as a long song, so they are saved for later. 'movie star' was one of those. the purpose of the session was to generate more material for vines. the 2 projects i was doing at the time were history of japan and maintaining daily vine uploads. i hope that makes sense

6.14.17  5:48 am   The one instrument available to me is a kiddies xylophone with a c4-c6 range. One cool trick that i saw in my fave band's music video is wrapping mullets in cloth, so I took a couple of napkins and now I like the sound that I produce even more. Do you know any other cool tricks for playing xylophone?

     you can use the other end of the stick for a very tiny, light sound

6.14.17  5:44 am   how to do a harmony ??

     try using multiple notes at the same time

6.14.17  5:34 am   is answering questions a part of your daily routine

     yes

     santa claus

6.14.17  3:45 am   why are bad words bad?

     it depends which ones you think are bad, and why

6.14.17  3:37 am   Are you worried about time travelers potentially messing up the accuracy of your history videos?

     well if they do then they already did

6.14.17  3:35 am   i just realised it is better to be nice than to not be nice

     there is confusion sometimes because some people think different things are nice

6.14.17  3:30 am   what if you have so many things that you want to do, but you can't decide which one to do first because you want to only do the best thing you think of but you don't know if you'll think of something better?

     keep thinking this way and do nothing until you can't stand it anymore. then your priorities will change to 'do anything' instead of 'do the best thing'. there are more changes to occur after that as well

6.14.17  3:24 am   where can we fan-mail you

     here

     and is your instagram @notbillwurtz?

     yes

6.14.17  3:12 am   do you ever feel like your content isn't taken seriously as art you spend time putting thought and effort into creating?

     i think it is taken in a wide variety of ways, including the ways that i meant it. even if i'm not sure

6.14.17  2:55 am   I was reading your questions in class earlier today and one of them was lit up in green so I clicked it and it blared out "I like music, I like music" or something, point is you got me in trouble

     i think you need to better understand how to keep your phone silent on the internet

6.14.17  2:33 am   Will your Movie Star song have a video like New Canaan, Alphabet Shuffle, and etc.?

     no
